_meta.description: GRC Knowledge Graph nodes â€” frameworks, families, controls, baselines, service models, evidence types, document types

control_families._comment: NIST 800-53 families (canonical hub), plus key groupings from other frameworks

nist.label: AC - Access Control
nist.focus: Account management, enforcement, least privilege, remote access

nist.label: CM - Configuration Management
nist.focus: Baselines, change control, least functionality, inventory

nist.label: PL - Planning
nist.focus: Security plans, rules of behavior, architecture

nist.label: PM - Program Management
nist.focus: CISO role, risk strategy, enterprise architecture

nist.label: SA - System and Services Acquisition
nist.focus: SDLC, acquisition, supply chain, developer security

nist.label: SI - System and Information Integrity
nist.focus: Flaw remediation, monitoring, alerting, memory protection

soc2.label: CC6 - Logical and Physical Access Controls

iso27001.label: Theme 5 - Organizational Controls
iso27001.focus: 37 controls: policies, roles, threat intel, asset management, access, supplier relations

iso27001.label: Theme 6 - People Controls
iso27001.focus: 8 controls: screening, employment terms, awareness, disciplinary, termination

iso27001.label: Theme 7 - Physical Controls
iso27001.focus: 14 controls: perimeters, entry, offices, monitoring, utilities, cabling, equipment

iso27001.label: Theme 8 - Technological Controls
iso27001.focus: 34 controls: endpoints, access rights, authentication, capacity, malware, backups, logging, networks

pci_dss.label: Req 7 - Restrict Access by Need to Know

gdpr.label: Chapter 2 — Principles
gdpr.focus: Lawfulness, purpose limitation, data minimisation, accuracy, storage limitation, integrity, accountability

gdpr.label: Chapter 3 — Data Subject Rights
gdpr.focus: Transparency, access, rectification, erasure, portability, objection

gdpr.label: Chapter 4 — Controller and Processor
gdpr.focus: Obligations, DPbD, records, security, breach notification, DPIA, DPO

gdpr.label: Chapter 7 — Cooperation and Consistency
gdpr.focus: Lead authority, mutual assistance, consistency mechanism

nist171.label: 3.1 Access Control
nist171.focus: Limit access, enforce flow, separation, least privilege, remote access, wireless, mobile, external, PII

3.6 Incident Response
3.7 Maintenance
3.8 Media Protection
nist171.focus: Protect, limit access, sanitize, transport, mark

nist171.label: 3.9 Personnel Security
nist171.focus: Screen individuals, protect CUI during personnel actions

nist171.label: 3.10 Physical Protection
nist171.focus: Limit access, protect/monitor facility, escort visitors

nist171.label: 3.11 Risk Assessment
3.12 Security Assessment
3.13 System and Communications Protection
3.14 System and Information Integrity
nist171.focus: Identify/report flaws, protect from malicious code, monitor

nist171.label: Limit system access to authorized users
Limit system access to authorized transactions and functions
Control CUI flow in accordance with approved authorizations
Separate duties of individuals to reduce risk
Employ principle of least privilege
Use non-privileged accounts for non-security functions
Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions
Limit unsuccessful logon attempts
Provide privacy and security notices consistent with CUI rules
Use session lock with pattern-hiding displays
Terminate user sessions after defined conditions
Monitor and control remote access sessions
Employ cryptographic mechanisms for remote access
Route remote access via managed access control points
Authorize remote execution of privileged commands
Authorize wireless access prior to allowing connections
Protect wireless access using authentication and encryption
Control connection of mobile devices
Encrypt CUI on mobile devices
Verify and control external system connections
Limit use of portable storage devices on external systems
Control CUI posted or processed on publicly accessible systems
Ensure personnel are aware of security risks
Ensure personnel are trained to carry out responsibilities
Provide security awareness training on recognizing social engineering
Create and retain audit records
Ensure actions can be traced to individual users
Review and update audited events
Alert on audit logging process failure
Correlate audit record review, analysis, and reporting
Provide audit record reduction and report generation
Provide capability to compare and synchronize clocks
Protect audit information and tools from unauthorized access
Limit management of audit logging to authorized individuals
Establish and maintain baseline configurations
Establish and enforce security configuration settings
Track, review, approve/disapprove, and log changes
Analyze security impact of changes prior to implementation
Define, document, approve, and enforce access restrictions
Employ principle of least functionality
Restrict, disable, or prevent nonessential programs
Apply deny-by-exception (blacklisting) policy for software
Control and monitor user-installed software
Identify system users, processes, or devices
Authenticate users, processes, or devices as prerequisite to access
Use multifactor authentication for local and network access
Employ replay-resistant authentication mechanisms
Prevent reuse of identifiers for a defined period
Disable identifiers after a defined period of inactivity
Enforce minimum password complexity
Prohibit password reuse for a specified number of generations
Allow temporary password use for system logons with immediate change
Store and transmit only cryptographically-protected passwords
Obscure feedback of authentication information
Establish operational incident-handling capability
Track, document, and report incidents
Test organizational incident response capability
Perform maintenance on organizational systems
Provide controls on tools, techniques, and personnel for maintenance
Ensure equipment removed for maintenance is sanitized
Check media containing diagnostic programs for malicious code
Require multifactor authentication for remote maintenance
Supervise maintenance activities of personnel without required access
Protect system media containing CUI (paper and digital)
Limit access to CUI on system media to authorized users
Sanitize or destroy system media before disposal or reuse
Mark media with CUI distribution and handling caveats
Control access to media containing CUI; maintain accountability
Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect CUI on portable media
Control use of removable media on system components
Prohibit use of portable storage when owner/origin is unknown
Protect confidentiality of backup CUI at storage locations
Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to CUI systems
Ensure CUI is protected during and after personnel actions
Limit physical access to organizational systems
Protect and monitor the physical facility
Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity
Maintain audit logs of physical access
Control and manage physical access devices
Enforce safeguarding measures for CUI at alternate work sites
Periodically assess risk to operations and assets
Scan for vulnerabilities periodically and when new vulnerabilities identified
Remediate vulnerabilities in accordance with risk assessments
Periodically assess security controls
Develop and implement plans of action to correct deficiencies
Monitor security controls on an ongoing basis
Develop, document, and periodically update system security plans
Monitor, control, and protect communications at boundaries
Employ architectural designs that promote effective security
Separate user functionality from system management functionality
Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer
Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components
Deny network communications traffic by default
Prevent remote devices from establishing non-remote connections
Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure
Terminate network connections at end of sessions
Establish and manage cryptographic keys
Employ FIPS-validated cryptography
Prohibit remote activation of collaborative computing devices
Control and monitor use of mobile code
Control and monitor use of VoIP technologies
Protect authenticity of communications sessions
Protect confidentiality of CUI at rest
Identify, report, and correct system flaws in a timely manner
Provide protection from malicious code
Monitor system security alerts and advisories and take action
Update malicious code protection mechanisms when new releases available
Perform periodic and real-time scans; scan files from external sources
Monitor organizational systems including inbound/outbound traffic
Identify unauthorized use of organizational systems
